RimVore2.QuirkPoolDef.label: Storage capacity
RimVore2.QuirkPoolDef.description: These quirks determine how many prey can fit in the pawn. The volume of a preything is its body size. A predator's capacity is a multiplier of its body size.

RimVore2.QuirkDef.label: Godlike Capacity
RimVore2.QuirkDef.description: [PAWN_label]'s skin is supernaturally stretchy, able to expand to sizes that defy all logic and reason. No matter how full [PAWN_pronoun] gets, [PAWN_pronoun] seemingly always has room for one more.

RimVore2.QuirkDef.label: Cavernous
RimVore2.QuirkDef.description: [PAWN_label] can stuff [PAWN_objective]self silly with prey and still have room for more, though even [PAWN_pronoun] has limits.

RimVore2.QuirkDef.label: Stretchy
RimVore2.QuirkDef.description: [PAWN_label] can stretch to fit more prey than the average predator.

RimVore2.QuirkDef.label: Normal capacity
RimVore2.QuirkDef.description: [PAWN_label] can fit as many prey as anyone else.

RimVore2.QuirkDef.label: Tight
RimVore2.QuirkDef.description: [PAWN_label] struggles to fit as many prey inside [PAWN_objective]self as most of [PAWN_possessive] predatory peers can; there's only room for one, maybe (by default).

RimVore2.QuirkDef.label: Claustrophobic
RimVore2.QuirkDef.description: [PAWN_label] struggles with a lack of capacity for prey. [PAWN_pronoun] can't eat prey of the same size (by default), and fills up fast otherwise.
